intro: Gouania leptostachya var. subtomentosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf gouania, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
